Options:

(B) one
(C) two
(D) three
(E) four
(F) five
(G) six
(H) seven
(I) eight
(J) nine
(K) ten
(L) eleven
(M) twelve
(N) thirteen
(O) fourteen
(P) fifteen
(Q) sixteen
model_outputs.model_answer:

1. One mauve cat toy.
2. Two purple cat toys.
3. Three grey cat toys.
4. Two mauve notebooks.
5. Three grey notebooks.
6. Three burgundy cat toys.
7. One purple notebook.

Now, we are asked to remove all the notebooks from the floor. So, eventually, there will be:

- One mauve cat toy
- Two purple cat toys
- Three grey cat toys
- Three burgundy cat toys
- One purple notebook (the other one has already been removed)

Now, let's count how many objects are grey:

1. Three grey cat toys
2. Three grey notebooks

After removing all the notebooks from the floor, there will be:

- Three grey cat toys
- Three grey notebooks
- One purple notebook

So, there will be 3 grey objects remaining on the floor.

The correct answer is (C) two.
